full_threads.body:
Hi WolfIQ team,

Quick question: since we launched the new site using the same domain, I wanted to check what happened to our old WordPress site?

Was it archived, backed up or removed entirely? There's one thing I'd like to check on the old site, if it's still availabe.

Many thanks,

Maddy

Madalyn Busby
Marketing and Engagement Team Lead | Muscular Dystrophy NSW

P: (02) 8986 9014
E: madalyn.busby@mdnsw.org.au

Hi Maddy,

Thank you so much, and really glad to hear the mobile layout’s looking better now.

Just let us know if you need anything from us, we’re always happy to jump in and help.

Hi Allie,

The donate form now looks great on mobile. But thanks for pointing out the CAPTCHA - that is quite an issue. On mobile, it's stopping me from being able to finish a test donation. I will pass that on internally. In the meantime, I will reactivate the forward to the external donate page to avoid any issues.

Thanks for getting those archive links fixed. Noted re Annual Reports.

Many thanks,

Maddy

Madalyn Busby
Marketing and Engagement Team Lead | Muscular Dystrophy NSW

P: (02) 8986 9014
E: madalyn.busby@mdnsw.org.au

Hi Maddy,

Hope you’re doing well!

Thanks for flagging the mobile issue with the donate page. We’ve made updates to improve the mobile layout and have made the donate form responsive.

You can check it out here: mdnsw.org.au/donate

Just a quick note—the CAPTCHA is still overlapping some elements, and unfortunately, that’s not something we’re able to adjust from our side.

We’ve also fixed the “e-newsletter” archive links and applied the same update to the Impact Reports archive:
  • Talking Point archive
  • Annual Report archive
    (Just a note: we noticed the Annual Reports currently don’t have featured images. We can jump in and add those as soon as you’ve got an image ready.)

Let me know if there’s anything else you’d like us to take a look at, always happy to help!

Hi Maddy,
Hope you’re doing well!
Thanks for flagging the mobile issue with the donate page. We’ve made updates to improve the mobile layout and have made the donate form responsive. You can check it out here: mdnsw.org.au/donate
Just a quick note—the CAPTCHA is still overlapping some elements, and unfortunately, that’s not something we’re able to adjust from our side.
We’ve also fixed the “e-newsletter” archive links and applied the same update to the Impact Reports archive:
  • Talking Point archive
  • Annual Report archive
    (Just a note: we noticed the annual reports currently don’t have featured images.)
Let me know if there’s anything else you’d like us to take a look at—happy to help!

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena
Allie Borcena assigned to LJ De La Peña

full_threads.body:
Hi Daphne,

Thanks for the update - that's great that the code is added and it's now displaying as it should. Thank you!

However, noting on mobile the form isn't optimised. Is that something that can be fixed? See screenshot below..



Thanks for looking into the newsletter and annual report content.

Many thanks,

Maddy

Madalyn Busby
Marketing and Engagement Team Lead | Muscular Dystrophy NSW

P: (02) 8986 9014
E: madalyn.busby@mdnsw.org.au

Hi @allieB @daphne,

I've updated the code to be global instead.

cc @ljD
Hi @allieB, all good on this one, its applied globally :)

Hey Team, can you apply it to this as well when like they pointed out about searching annual products and then they click it would point them to the link below
  1. https://mdnsw.org.au/2022-2023-mdnsw-annual-impact-report/

Awesome team, thank you for the fast support 🙏
I'll draft a message to this

Hi @allieB @daphne,

All done on this one.

  • If you search “Talking Point” and click an article, it will now redirect to associated newsletter link.
    So basically https://mdnsw.org.au/june-2025-talking-point/ redirecting to https://createsend.com/t/t-24D5C6FB45A37F912540EF23F30FEDED

THanks @ljD!

action.text: Cindy Valderama assigned to LJ De La Peña
Allie Borcena assigned to Cindy Valderama

full_threads.body:
Hey @daphne ,
Just a quick heads-up—I took a look at this ticket and noticed a difference in behavior:

  • If you search “Talking Point” and click an article, it leads to this page:
    https://mdnsw.org.au/june-2025-talking-point/
  • But if you go through the Newsletter page and click the same article, it correctly opens this version:
    https://createsend.com/t/t-24D5C6FB45A37F912540EF23F30FEDED

It sounds like they’d prefer everything to follow that second (Createsend) format.

Let me know if you'd like me to dig any deeper on this!

CC: @cindy

action.text: Allie Borcena moved this conversation from the Alerts inbox

full_threads.body:
@allieB - can you check on this please.


We’re also looking into the search behavior you flagged. Specifically:
  1. When searching terms like “Talking Point” or “Annual report”, the tiles are linking to the post pages rather than directly to the intended content.
  2. We’re comparing this to the functionality on the Newsletter page, which behaves correctly.

action.text: Daphne Bautista assigned to Allie Borcena
